body_html: You can, but you if you want to be super-safe, I'd probably recommend to cut down the model to two or three standard layers and put random data of the appropriate size through them. That keeps your privacy and saves me a ton of work (because that would be the first thing I have to do after I figured out how to get your code running), so it means I can zoom into the error and fix it faster (if you look at the bug that I thought might be related, there it took only 15 minutes from taking the minimal reproduction example to the first fix even if that didn't end up to be the one that got adopted; I've never spent less than half a day to get other people's code to run).

body: You can, but you if you want to be super-safe, I'd probably recommend to cut down the model to two or three standard layers and put random data of the appropriate size through them. That keeps your privacy and saves me a ton of work (because that would be the first thing I have to do *after* I figured out how to get your code running), so it means I can zoom into the error and fix it faster (if you look at the bug that I thought might be related, there it took only 15 minutes from taking the minimal reproduction example to the first fix even if that didn't end up to be the one that got adopted; I've never spent less than half a day to get other people's code to run).
